byline.contributor: Benjamin Mueller and Nate Schweber contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr., ASHLEY SOUTHALL and AL BAKER

abstract: Police have struggled to solve 2016 murder of Adrian Maldonado in South Bronx's Melrose Houses, public housing complex's 13th murder since 2010; murder rate has remained stubbornly high at Melrose even as it has plummeted in rest of city; investigations into killings, several of which remain unsolved, have been stymied by witnesses' reluctance to approach police and run afoul of violent gangs in area (Series: Murder in the 4-0).
lead_paragraph: Adrian Maldonado was killed after a drug deal at a Bronx housing complex. Rumors focused on a spurned lover, but witnesses were reluctant to come forward over fears of reprisals.
snippet: Adrian Maldonado was killed after a drug deal at a Bronx housing complex. Rumors focused on a spurned lover, but witnesses were reluctant to come forward over fears of reprisals....

headline.main: A Man Is Shot in the Back, and Only the Police Are Kept in the Dark
headline.print_headline: Bronx Killing Leaves Only the Police in the Dark
